snippet: The deal, which required unanimous approval by delegates from around the world, will for the first time commit nearly every country to lowering greenhouse gas emissions.
abstract: Representatives of 195 nations reach historic agreement to reduce greenhouse-gas emissions that contribute to global warming; agreement differs from past efforts in that it requires some degree of effort from all nations involved, including developing and poor nations often exempted in past; scientists warn agreement is not a solution in itself and that failure to honor it will leave little recourse.

byline.contributor: Sewell Chan, Melissa Eddy, Justin Gillis and Stanley Reed contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The deal, which required unanimous approval by delegates from around the world, will for the first time commit nearly every country to lowering greenhouse gas emissions.

headline.main: Nations Approve Landmark Climate Accord in Paris

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
